sections.doc_:
## Introduction

[`amp-pixel`](/content/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-pixel-vundefined.md) is a lightweight mechanism for measuring pageviews.  It provides functionality similar to [`amp-analytics`](/content/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-analytics-v0.1.md), but only includes a single event (views), and offers fewer transport mechanisms and variables.

## Introduction

[`amp-pixel`](/content/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-pixel-vundefined.md) is a lightweight mechanism for measuring pageviews.  It provides functionality similar to [`amp-analytics`](/content/amp-dev/documentation/components/reference/amp-analytics-v0.1.md), but only includes a single event (views), and offers fewer transport mechanisms and variables.

sections.doc_: `amp-pixel` is a built-in component and does not require loading an extension.

sections.doc_: The `amp-pixel` issues a simple GET request to the given URL and ignores the result.  This is a fast way to track pageviews.
sections.normalizedDoc_: The `amp-pixel` issues a simple GET request to the given URL and ignores the result.  This is a fast way to track pageviews.

sections.doc_: The variables noted in amp-var-substitutions will be interpolated in the URL as a way to capture some meaningful data.
sections.normalizedDoc_: The variables noted in amp-var-substitutions will be interpolated in the URL as a way to capture some meaningful data.

sections.doc_: The optional `referrerpolicy` attribute allows you to strip the 'Referrer' header in the outbound HTTP request.  Other values of `referrerpolicy` that are valid for other tags (e.g. `amp-img`) are not available for `amp-pixel`.
